alert.note: Alert for Clark; Madison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 9:47AM EST until February 20 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Ford Lock affecting Madison and Clark Counties. .Heavy rain from the past week have caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Ford Lock. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying portions of Fort Boonesborough State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 26.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Sunday was 26.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 03/05/1934. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tonight when the river falls below minor flood stage.
